text.p: The Mediterranean Games proved a literally pointless experience for Albanian tennis player Imed Sejati.
The Albanian, whose age was given at between 15 and 18, made a brief and spectacularly unsuccessful debut at the Games in Bari, Italian newspapers reported on Monday.
After watching his unknown Moroccan opponent fire four straight aces past him in the first game, Sejati replied with four successive double faults. Then he retired, smiling.
